# BE <> bau <> pro

𒅁𒁍𒌑 ib-bu-ú be 𒅁𒁀𒋛 ib-ba-si be/sei 𒁀𒀾𒋢𒌑 ba-as-su-u2 was/sei / were

From Proto-Indo-European *bʰuH-

𓁹 ⲓⲉⲣ ⋍ ⲓⲣⲓ ⇔ voir faire < 𓃀 𓂋 𓂂 𓂂 бер ⲃⲁⲗ > ver- be-

Perso-Germanic root of existence
Irish: bí

Croatian: постојати, postojati

Gothic: 𐍅𐌹𐍃𐌰𐌽 wisan Wesen Dasein
Egyptian: 𓃹𓃺 HaBen/HaSen being > wnn

Greek: ὑπάρχω hupárkhō ὑπόκειμαι hupókeimai
Greek: φύω (phúō) (Ancient)
Georgian: არსებობა arseboba 𓃹 არსებობს arsebobs
Hindi: होना honā < 𓃹 wnna
Ukrainian: бу́ти (uk) (búty)

𓊅 *būwaną «bewohnen» “to dwell, reside” from Proto-Indo-European *bʰúHt, from *bʰuH- “to become, grow, appear” bear
𒅁𒁍𒌑 𒍣𒄫𒋙 ib-bu-ú zi-kir-šú being decreed for (for his name)

𒁉 BI = BE ⋍ 𒁁𒁁 BÀD in Akkadian font

abode baut بَيْت bayt বাড়ি baṛi banesë ⇔ 𐌱𐌰𐌿𐌰𐌹𐌽𐍃 √*bhō̆u “to be”

быць (be) (bycʹ)

Being 𓃹 𓆑
